required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Single Rising Oral Doses of BI 44847 Administered to Healthy Male Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Single Rising Oral Doses (50 mg to 800 mg) of BI 44847 as Tablet(s) Administered to Healthy Male Subjects. A Randomised, Placebo-controlled (Within Dose Groups) and Double-blinded Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Study to investigate safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of BI 44847 in Japanese healthy volunteers

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with clinically relevant changes in vital signs
Number of patients with clinically relevant finding in 12-lead electrocardiogram (ECG)
Number of patients with clinically relevant changes in laboratory parameters
Number of patients with adverse events

secondary_outcome.measure: Cmax (maximum concentration of the analyte in plasma)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: tmax (time from dosing to maximum concentration)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC0-inf. (area under the concentration-time curve of the analyte in plasma over the time interval from 0 extrapolated to infinity)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: %AUCtz-∞ (the percentage of the AUC0-∞ that is obtained by extrapolation)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC0-tz (area under the concentration-time curve of the analyte in plasma over the time interval from 0 to the time of the last quantifiable data point)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48 hours after drug administration
up to 48 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: t1/2 (terminal half-life of the analyte in plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: MRTpo (mean residence time of the analyte in the body after po administration)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: CL/F (total clearance of the analyte in the plasma after extravascular administration)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Vz/F (apparent volume of distribution during the terminal phase λz following an extravascular dose)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Aet1-t2 (amount of analyte that is eliminated in urine from the time point t1 to time point t2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: fet1-t2 (fraction of analyte eliminated in urine from time point t1 to time point t2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: CLR,t1-t2 (renal clearance of the analyte from the time point t1 until the time point t2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma glucose concentration time curve
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 12 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Total amount of glucose excreted in the urine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48 hours after drug administration
up to 12 hours after drug administration
up to 48 hours after drug administration

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects will be healthy male volunteers who meet the criteria below:
- Persons without clinically remarkable findings or clinically evident complications based on their concurrent illness, past medical history, physical examination, vital signs (blood pressure, pulse rate, and body temperature), 12-lead ECG, and laboratory test results
- Persons who are 20 or older and 35 or younger
- Persons with a BMI 18.5 kg/m2 or more and 25.0 kg/m2 less
- Persons who are willing to participate in this trial before study initiation and who give their written consent in accordance with Good Clinical Practice
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any finding of the medical examination (including BP, Pulse Rate (PR) and ECG) deviating from normal and of clinical relevance
- Any evidence of a clinically relevant concomitant disease
- Gastrointestinal, hepatic, renal, respiratory, cardiovascular, metabolic, immunological or hormonal disorders
- Diseases of the central nervous system (such as epilepsy) or psychiatric disorders or neurological disorders
- History of relevant orthostatic hypotension, fainting spells or blackouts
- Chronic or relevant acute infections
- History of relevant allergy/hypersensitivity (including allergy to drug or its excipients)
- Intake of drugs with a long half-life (>24 hours) within at least one month or less than 10 half-lives of the respective drug prior to administration or during the trial
- Use of any drugs within 10 days prior to administration or during the trial
- Participation in another trial with an investigational drug within four months prior to administration or during the trial
- Smoker (>10 cigarettes or >3 cigars or >3 pipes/day)
- Inability to refrain from smoking on trial days
- Alcohol abuse (more than 60 g/day)
- Drug abuse
- Blood donation (more than 100 mL) within four weeks prior to administration or during the trial
- Excessive physical activities (within one week prior to administration or during the trial)
- Any laboratory value outside the reference range that is of clinical relevance
- Inability to comply with dietary regimen of study centre 19. A history of additional risk factors for torsade de pointes (e.g., heart failure, hypokalemia, family history of long QT syndrome)
- The use of concomitant medications that prolong the QT/QTc interval
- Any ECG value outside of the reference range and of clinical relevance including, but not limited to QRS interval >120 ms
- Elevated urinary glucose levels at screening (>15 mg/dl)
